storyPrompts.visualMetaphor: a door opening to light, but with shadows behind
storyPrompts.beforeContext: Years of carrying this weight alone
storyPrompts.afterContext: First steps toward letting it go

content:
# Morning Reflection

Today something shifted. I've been holding onto this for so long...

[Marked passage begins]
I realized I don't have to carry all of this anymore. The weight I've been
dragging through every day - it's not mine to carry. I can set it down.
I can choose differently.
[Marked passage ends]

It feels both terrifying and freeing. Like standing at the edge of something new.
excerpt:
I realized I don't have to carry all of this anymore. The weight I've been
dragging through every day - it's not mine to carry. I can set it down.
I can choose differently.

storyPrompts.visualMetaphor: roots growing deeper while branches reach skyward

content:
# Afternoon Walk

Walked through the park today. No agenda, just walking.

==The trees don't struggle to grow. They just grow. Maybe I can learn from that - not forcing, just allowing.==

Small steps. That's all it takes.
excerpt: The trees don't struggle to grow. They just grow. Maybe I can learn from that - not forcing, just allowing.

storyPrompts.visualMetaphor: climbing a mountain, slipping back, but keeping the summit in sight

content:
# Morning - After the Setback

Fell back into old patterns yesterday. Felt like I'd lost all progress.

```comic
But today I see it differently. Every time I choose again, even after falling,
I'm building the muscle of resilience. The mountain doesn't judge how many times
I slip. It just is. And I keep climbing.
```

This is the work. Not perfection. Progress.
excerpt: Every time I choose again, even after falling, I'm building the muscle of resilience. The mountain doesn't judge how many times I slip. It just is. And I keep climbing.
